website_summaries.verdict: An affordable model with a traditional design and nice finish. Great for those who are use to shaving with a safety razor, but not ideal for novices.
pros: Features a longer than average handle that has a fully textured finish that feels nice in the hand
Butterfly opening is easy to operate, and blade is straightforward to replace
cons: Comes with a bit of a learning curve to use it properly
In the meantime, you may experience skin nicks and razor burn

customer_reviews.title: Can I please return
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this razor for a little over a month now, and it isn’t easy to get into, i normally go over once but with this shaver I have to go over multiple times and it’s weigt throws me off. I curing myself also everytime I shave. I thoughts that was how it was, until I use a different handle and I love it. This one is not for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Pawn07

customer_reviews.title: Women approved
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this razor. As a women some,reviews made me nervous but I have used this razor to shave EVERY part of my body and it works great. Maybe not the smoothest shave in some areas ( like my armpits and Meow) but probably the equivalent to store a store bought 4 blade razor for my legs. Only a minor cut on my leg once but that was completely my own fault because I didn't have the blade screwed down tight enough. If your too scared watch a YouTube video on how to do it first.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Great Decision
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this razor. I got it, as a female, to replace using disposable razors. It was a great decision. It is so easy to use! I’ve only cut myself once with it versus how I used to cut myself like 5 times every time with disposables. I love how this was budget friendly. I haven’t had any trouble with ingrown hairs, razor burn, etc. The shave is smooth and lasts. I’m shaving once a week now where before I was shaving twice a week. If you’re thinking about trying a safety razor don’t hestitate! Give this one a try. You will be doing yourself and the environment a huge favor.
customer_reviews.author: Dresden Peppers

customer_reviews.title: Single razor for the ladies
customer_reviews.text: For the ladies to use that is... Close shave, took care of the delicate areas. A few nicks the first time, but that is typical for me with all razors. My only complaint is that the head is a little bulky, so it's a little difficult to maneuver in those tight areas. Overall I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Natural Mom

customer_reviews.title: Doors don't close properly.
customer_reviews.text: This explains why I kept cutting myself up so badly with this razor. I noticed that one door wasn't sitting down fully. Tonight I only used the side that fully closed, and I had a great shave. I did three passes, and not a single cut. Wish I wouldn't have gotten a bad one. So many people seem to love this razor. Think I might need to upgrade. Not sure if i want to risk buying another one of these, and possibly get another bad one.
customer_reviews.author: james staggs

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: This is an initial review and I’ll update it in 6-12 months. I was skeptical on using this kind of razor, due to cutting myself or any kind of user error. However, within two or three strokes with this product I felt comfortable. The instructions are clear and well written. Even though it’s a simple item and fairly straight forward to use. Also the twisting knob at the bottom requires a little bit of effort, so the latching mechanisms do stay closed while shaving! Recommending to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awful.
customer_reviews.text: This should be advertised as face shredder, instead of safety razor. Even with quality Astra blades, this thing carved up my face and neck something terrible. There was so much blood from all the nicks and cuts it gave me that it looked like a murder scene. I've never gotten a worse case of razor irritation/razor burn than I did from this thing. My face was angry, red, and painful for almost a week after using this thing. After trying to use it (with EXTREME care and caution), and still getting the same results, this joke of a razor went in the trash like the piece of garbage that it is. Don't waste your money on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: yes

customer_reviews.title: Makes you bleed a lot!!
customer_reviews.text: Tried everything, angle to skin, changed blades at least 4 times, real light drag against skin, different shave creams. I'm 66 years old and do not have sensitive skin this thing just cut me up every time. Never did get a full shave in 3 attempts. Tried to give it away with extra box of blades no one wanted it, cut my losses and threw it out. Junk. Use the disposable razors and electric never a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this torture device
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. It sucked when I first got it and it sucked when I tried it again a couple weeks ago. There are far better safety razors on here for only $15 more. This thing does 2 things great, cut your neck and sit in a trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Chainpuller

customer_reviews.title: Good for ladies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this some time ago now and love it. I was just getting started with DE shaving as a female, and didn't want to invest too much in case it didn't take. But, I have actually really grown to enjoy how it make shaving feel more like a nice self care ritual. This razor, aside from collecting a good amount of soap scum, has just the right length and size of handle for shaving legs. I've never had problems with losing my grip, or with the blade coming loose. I do make sure to tighten it before each use just in case. If you're a lady looking to get started, this will do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Jenelle L. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality safety razor
customer_reviews.text: This razor is so dull and so poor at removing hair it should be called a trimmer. And it is a poor trimmer at that. I wound up with alternating stubble and bad razor burn. Having used a safety razor before, I've never experienced such shamelessly poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kline

customer_reviews.title: New favorite razor handle
customer_reviews.text: I'll preface this by saying I am no expert or long term veteran to shaving with double-edge safety razors. What I can say is that of the 3 razor handles I own, this is my current favorite. Mostly I like the weight of this in my hands. It has some weight without being overwhelming. My other two razor handles are lighter than this and so I find I have to apply more pressure when using them to get them to cut. This has enough weight to let the handle do most of the work, which is what you want I think.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Great money saver.
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of paying crazy amounts for the Gillette refills. I have never found an electric razor I could use use, because my skin gets irritated and breaks up in a rash, so I’ve been using Gillette Pro Glide. It works good for me, but the cartridges are way overpriced. This product solves the price problems for refills, and it does the job great. It is tougher than those Gillette ones, so I cut myself the first few times I used it. Once you get used to it, it is great. Nice clean shave, easy to clean, and for the price, well worth the change.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: For a woman, it’s ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I really like this overall. I do nick my ankles, and I have a hard time getting a close shave. It also has a piece at the corner that scrapes my armpits when I shave them. I’ve had it for a few months now, and I feel like I’m getting better, but I’m not in love with it. Trying to reduce my plastic consumption, though. I may give this one to my husband when he runs out of his regular razor heads, as I suspect it would be better for a facial shave.
customer_reviews.author: Alana D.

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this razor
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I found this razor I bought a couple cheaply made ones a while back to try and the experience was ok the razors broke within weeks of having them so when this one came I inspected it. It is a very sturdy well made razor and the best shave ive ever had zero razor bump. For first timers the secret is angle and make sure to get mineral oil you can buy clipper oil or baby oil this keeps your razor from rusting and breaking down. Thank you weishi I love this razor
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN MINE!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a friend who was new to shaving. Being an environmentalist I have a similar model, but mine unscrews from the bottom to dismantle it and change out the blade. This one is even cooler because you twist the bottom of the handle and the top opens like a flower for easy access to the blade! the black and grey design is beautiful and the metal has remained scratch-free and rust-free. I will probably end up buying this for my younger brothers as well! LOVE this razor 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Sterling

customer_reviews.title: So far it's good. My issue with all previous razors is that ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it's good. My issue with all previous razors is that my extremely hard water causes them to rust once they get the slightest nick in the finish. I try to be as careful as possible, but then the threads get the chrome worn away and it starts to rust there. I bought this partially because of the butterfly design hoping that there would be less chance for it to rust and whatnot. It's only been a month but it shows no signs of rust or corrosion at all yet. I'll update in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Person

customer_reviews.title: learning curve....but worth it
customer_reviews.text: love mine. Close shave every time. Weight feels good. There is a bit of a learning curve with these kinds of razors.....but once you get used to it for how much money you save and how much plastic youre preventing from landfills it is so worth it. And again, after you get used to keeping it at the correct angle ots the best shave ever. Also, its actually kinda pretty of you like that minimalistic look
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hall

customer_reviews.title: OOOOOUUUUUUCCHHHHH!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if it is the mechanism itself or the blade that came with it. I was unable to finish my shave and pull out my strait razor to finish. I wanted an old style razor like my dads and this looks perfect. But it grabbed every hair on my face and felt like it was pulling them before cutting. I plan to pick up some blades today and see if it might be the quality of the blades. I will adjust my review accordingly and if that is the case, pull them worthless blades out and put some quality in or not at all. Holy Crap that hurt! My face still stings.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: #MyGrandpasRazor
customer_reviews.text: If you didn't get the headline I'll explain. this is an old school razor the comment my father had a razor just like that one has been made by my aunt, mother, and even my uncle so yes this is your grand or great grandfathers razor no multiblade no lotion or gel cover razor with four blades is just a simple single double-sided blade razor is easy to use, clean, and change the blades is strong so it doesn't break you can take it through airport security and the only requirements I recommend is having shaving cream and aftershave and double-sided blades.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos paez

customer_reviews.title: I have owned this for a few month
customer_reviews.text: Just started shaving my head now for close to 2 months. I bought this as a starter safety razor and really might just stick with it. I think the only thing I don't like about it is the included blades. Go out to walmart and pick up a set from a national brand and you'll feel the difference. Other than that the safety razor is built great and is ready for any beginner. I always wait a few months to review items to make sure I get a good feel from them and can give an honest review. This razor in my option is great for the price and overall a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice beginner shaver
customer_reviews.text: This was my first safety razor. I got zero save bumps when I used this razor with cremo shave cream and Nivea for men after shave. I was able to learn how to use it fairly quickly. YouTube it if you're scared. Pros: 1 no bumps 2your hair can be pretty long and still be able to use this shaver, it doesn't clog up Cons: 1 you have to go a bit slower than with a traditional shaver. 2 Doesn't give a baby's butt close smooth. It looks bald to the eye, but you can feel it 3 handle can get a little slippery when wet
customer_reviews.author: Malvi85

customer_reviews.title: First wet shave experience
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time purchasing a double edge razor. The cost of replaceable cartridges was getting too high for me. Using the razor takes some getting used to, but I like the weight in my hand and th close shave it provides. Really easy to replace the blades with the butterfly opening. Great that it came with a pack of replacement blades also.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: My first safety razor
customer_reviews.text: Replacing foils are SO much cheaper than disposables, and much faster than my electric (which eventually died anyway). I had some nicks when I first started (especially on the neck) until I got used to it. I would prefer less width on the standard size blades for contours, but they're standard so nothing I can do about that. This particular razor has a flawless butterfly mechanism, and good weight to drag. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: kheper

customer_reviews.title: Still not better than disposible.
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to find the perfect razor for shaving my head that does the job right. On the advice I heard in a podcast, I bought a safety razor. This safety razor came up on sale, so that was what I based my buying decision on. I tried it on my head and face. So far, it has done the worst out of the products I have tried. Lots of nicks, and still does the same bad job the disposable ones do. On my face and neck it does just as bad as a cheap disposable. For some, this kind of razor may work, but for me, it did not.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Mild Razor/Very Hard to cut yourself (Thank God)
customer_reviews.text: I took the plunge and picked this DE, since I heard it was mild--it's hard to cut yourself, but the shave it gives me is very satisfactory.. I would say it's equivalent to a DORCO 4/6 disposable razor (I used to use this) in terms of getting a close shave. The disposable blades that come with the Weishi are not great; wouldn't give the shave I need. The blades I bought immediately were the Astra blades and oh man..they're awesome; and I saved money rather than getting those disposable razors. Also, works great with canned shaving foam, if you're like me lazy to do it the proper way..lol
customer_reviews.author: Chilifries

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking
customer_reviews.text: I had been shaving with a Merkur razor until my kit was stolen - thought I would save money this time round thinking that these things work on the same principle. The sexy black coating wore off within a month. Plus, due to the blade clamp continually coming lose, I cut myself whilst shaving for the first time ever - proper blood running down my neck type of cut. Basically, this is just cheap, nasty and dangerous. I went on to buy a Edwin Jagger Double Edge Safety Razor, which has been great. Do not buy this - Spend a little more and get something safer.
customer_reviews.author: NancyEnglish

customer_reviews.title: Perfect double edge safety razor
customer_reviews.text: This razor is fantastic! It comes in an attractive looking box and a small instruction booklet on to operate the razor, change blades, shave, etc. Just a tad heavier and longer than my other razor, it has a solid, rustic feel and the butterfly blade mechanism works perfectly. It makes changing out the blades a lot easier as opposed to screwing off the entire head every time. The blades that came with it work alright, but I already have a stockpile of Astra razors to use. Overall, it’s a great product, and for the price and speed of the shipping, worth every penny. Shaving just became fun again. 🤘🏻
customer_reviews.author: blackhawksguy_11

customer_reviews.title: Trans-Woman Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I chose to invest in a good safety razor, I only shaved with it once (soap and water, no shaving cream as recommended) and I nicked my face three times, BUT, and this is a big but here, NO RAZOR BURN. This is really a game changer! And I am sure I will get better at shaving without nicking myself as I practice with this new razor. The easiest and smoothest shave with the least pain I have had the pleasure of getting yet. ^-^
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had Shaved This Way All Along
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Better and closer shave, much less expensive than cartridges, AND better for the environment!!?? Whats not to love? It requires more technique and time, but what a luxurious shave! This one specifically is of great quality and build/materials. I have to use dish soap to clean mine after because of the soap residue from the lather, but that may just be the kind of soap lather I am using. I'm going to try others, but it cleans up real nice back to its jewelry-like shine. I wish I had shaved this way years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is my first safety razor I’ve ever purchased - trying to make strides being more eco-friendly! I was hesitant to use it as I’ve heard horror stories but I found this razor so easy to use and extremely beginner friendly. Personally, I found it was a little bit easier to use outside of the shower and using small strokes that go with the hair on my legs and under arms. It also looks a lot better in my shower than the plastic ones lol. My sister said it’s the nicest looking razor she has ever seen as I was unboxing it!
customer_reviews.author: mlouise

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I've given less blood at a Red Cross blood drive. Background: I have been shaving my face for a little more than 60 years. I recently began shaving my head, which led to a mild case of Razor Acquisition Syndrome. I now have, in addition to my vintage Gillette Blue Tip and Gillette Adjustable, an Edwin Jagger de89, Merkur 34c, RazoRock Quick Change, and RazoRock Teck 2. I wanted to try a longer handle, so I bought the Weishi Nostalgic. I tried it with Astra and Gillette 7 O'Clock blades, both of which performed perfectly in my Gillette Adjustable. Both blades produced nicks, cuts, scrapes, and razor burn in the Weishi. I won't be using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Harry LaBelle

customer_reviews.title: best shave ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this razor. *Lady Review* I did knick myself the first few times I used it, but nothing serious. Now I'm totally used to it and can shave just as fast as I did before without any issues. I change the blade about every 2 weeks and it's really easy to do. I never got this close of a shave with a Venus, or any other grocery store brand. The handle is heavy and has a nice feel to it. You just twist it to open up the top to switch out the blade. I love the price point on this and am VERY happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Caudill

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye disposable razors
customer_reviews.text: Prior to owning this razor, I would usually shave in the shower with cheap disposable razors without a mirror. It was just a chore to do, so there was little enjoyment to it and often led to nicks and minor breakouts. The Weishi safety razor is enjoyable to use as you easily, effortlessly, and painlessly cut away stubble and longer facial hair. I don't blame Mr. Gillette for inventing his disposable razor, but I no longer need to buy them anymore. If you're timid about using the Weishi safety razor, watch some youtube videos and you'll see it's not that complicated. Don't expect perfection your first time, though.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great for women prone to razor burn, your budget, and the planet
customer_reviews.text: I have always struggled with razor burn since I was a teenager. I always thought it was because I wasn't using razors with enough blades so I used to spend a fortune on razors with 5 blades. Using this razor made me realize that my problem was always that drug store razor blades are just not as sharp as butterfly razor blades. I've had 0 razor burn and a much closer shave since using this product. My wallet also appreciates how affordable blades are now!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner shaver; Mild to Medium Agressive; Use Good Blades
customer_reviews.text: I would say I am intermediate experienced shaver. Been using for 3 months. To be clear, I have NOT using the blades that came with the shaver. I am using Astra Platinum blades. Shaver is not aggressive at all. I had a cheaper one, that was aggressive and caused razor burn all the time. This one, I can shave over the same place multiple times and not cause burn. The blade seems to last longer too. I'd recommend highly for beginner shavers, BUT get some good blades.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this razor since I left my other 3 piece saftey razor at a relatives house. It's a decent razor if ur new to the saftey-butterfly razor scene, craftsmanship is typical made in china product, looks good until u use it and start looking in detail. If ur looking for something aggressive or have thick facial hair you will need something that exposes more blade, since just a tiny edge is visible it takes several passes to knock down thick stubble over all u can find a better razor for the same price if not less.
customer_reviews.author: Denise E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Razor For Women
customer_reviews.text: I was so sick of buying terrible razors that were more expensive just because they were for women. I finally decided to buy this despite being afraid of cutting myself as a clumsy person. I am so glad I bought this. Buying razor blades is so much cheaper, the blade lasts so much longer, it gets a closer shave, doesn't cause razor bumps, and so much more. The only thing is it can be tricky to shave in a crease, like your armpit. Otherwise I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product, not as easy as a typical razor.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help reduce the amount of plastic waste I create. It comes with a set of 5 blades but after reading reviews I went ahead and bought a different set. This razor works very well, if used correctly. You have to use a different angle than with your typical plastic razor, which takes some getting used to. I definitely miss the moving joint on my old razor, but this one does the job as long as you put in the effort. I keep it in the shower and I've had no problems with rust. Great product, just takes some practice.
customer_reviews.author: Emma S.

customer_reviews.title: Out of box, great
customer_reviews.text: Just got this delivered tonight. Never used a safety razor before. I popped in one of the included blades, and used it mostly dry on a week's growth of beard. After wetting my face with warm water, and periodically cleaning out the whiskers, I got a decent shave in about five minutes. Would have taken at least two disposable razors and twice the time. No nicks or blood or anything. First-time user of this style, and I'm not going back to any other kind of shaving equipment: looking forward to my new shipment of Astra blades, but the trial five blades included seemed fine to me.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had switched years ago. My Dad had a razor this style growing up. As a new shaver I used to nick my legs so I was afraid to switch but after years of shaving I don't have a problem. This is cheaper and more environmentally friendly. I am recommending this style to friends and family. This particular razor has a good weight and fits well in my hand. It is easy to change blades. I expect it to last a long, long time
customer_reviews.author: RLMD

customer_reviews.title: Wish this was a better razor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Feather twist-to-open that I use for travel and left in a hotel room. On paper and per reviews, it looked great, and is well-finished and much nicer in the hand than the Feather. In practice, it is slightly more aggressive (not necessarily a bad thing), but the poor support of the bottom blade combined with misalignment of the center bar result in a 'chattery' shave with one side of the blade more exposed than the other. May be just a manufacturing variation in the one I got, but going back to another Feather.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Opens too easily. Let shaving review.
customer_reviews.text: The twist feature to open it, gets loose really easily. I use it to shave my legs and I feel like every few swipes I need to tighten it again. This is when I shave both in and out of the shower. I got this for the longer handle specifically, but if I can't hold it near the end, that longer handle is useless. I'm really upset I may have to invest in another razor. It may be better for someone who is just shaving their face and holding it closer to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Micki

customer_reviews.title: Works well, bit of a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: I like the product so far. You can tell it's a little cheaply made because it doesn't get that super smooth perfect shave unless you go over it a few times. Never cut myself though, not even when assembling, so I consider that to a huge plus considering I am a literal train wreck that injures themselves quite often. Used it on my legs and armpits and it worked well enough. Haven't had it long yet though, will update if anything changes. Tried to use it at first after having a few drinks and couldn't figure out how to put it together so my advice is definitely do it sober X'D
customer_reviews.author: Spock

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. After getting it, i started using it, to which I use it full time. The handle is sturdy and slip resistant, the shutters stay shut, no noise. I talked to my barber, whom suggested to use personna blades, which are super sharp. I love this thing. Yeah, when I first tried it I nicked my self a few times, but nothing major, all little nicks that a normal razor today would leave. I do say, however, when shaving, takes your time and go with then against the grain, or you going to have a bad day, but the result are having the smoothest skin. Price was great as well! Will recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ale

customer_reviews.title: A good value for the money and price point, works well and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Surprised how much I liked this. I was worried at the price point that it would feel cheap and be of poor construction. I think it important to state that this is not as nice or well made as a razor that would cost 4-5 times more, but for an inexpensive razor I am very content. I was using a vintage metal one and the angle and the hold of the blade was causing some skin irritation as well as not shaving as close as I wanted. This one holds the blade well, opens easily and I find that angle of the shave is super. Easy to clean and to use. Would recommend to those looking for a well-priced razor
customer_reviews.author: Tomdabom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent entry level safety razor for those thinking about using one.
customer_reviews.text: I have given up on electric razors over 20 years ago. I was using cheap disposables instead. In 40+ years of shaving I never used a "safety razor" until tonight. I didn't use any shaving cream at all. I simply lathered up with Dove moisturizing soap. Well this razor gave a very close shave with no cuts whatsoever. The unit appears well constructed, the blade is well aligned. I have no idea how durable the unit is or how many shaves I will get out of the 5 blades that shipped with it. In the long run it will probably be cheaper then using disposables.
customer_reviews.author: david cravit

customer_reviews.title: Scary at first but now I’m hooked
customer_reviews.text: The price is great and the handle seems durable. It was frightening the first 3 times I used it but it takes practice to get the angle right. Go slow and watch some you tube tutorials. I almost returned it but gave it a try two more times and now I’m getting the hang of it. I’m never going back to those plastic disposable razors, I’m hooked and it makes me feel awesome knowing I’m not being so wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: Hilda

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Merkur 34c HD instead of this garbage
customer_reviews.text: I have used this weishi razor and let me just tell you that this razor cut me so many times that it almost deterred me from using safety razors. Threw this garbage razor in the trash after a couple of uses. I highly suggest all of you to spend extra money on a more premium safety razor such as the merkur 34c HD. I have been using the merkur for some time now and it is absolutely amazing, it is neutrally aggressive, good razor for all beginners, and makes it hard to cut yourself. Side note: I use the ad astra platinum blades, so the problem with the weishi razor could not have been my blades.
customer_reviews.author: Majid

customer_reviews.title: The "free" blades that come with the razor are junk
customer_reviews.text: My first shave with this razor, using an included blade, was torture. It felt like the hairs were being pulled out by the roots. I initially blamed the new razor, but decided to try a blade that I had on hand from a previous Amazon purchase. The second shave with the razor and a new Personna brand blade was as expected. I will continue to use the razor and will update the review after a few more shaves.
customer_reviews.author: jdsquire

customer_reviews.title: Make the switch
customer_reviews.text: I was worried a straight blade razor would be hard to use but found it very easy. It did not irritate my skin like disposable razors and I haven't cut myself any more than usual. It's easy to tell when it is time to change the blade (there are two sides and you can flip it over). The only drawback is the knob at the end of the handle which is used to release the blade; it turns often during normal use. I have to regularly stop mid shave to tighten it. Not a big deal but it would be better if it "locked" in place. I like wasting less plastic and how inexpensive replacement blades are compared to disposables.
customer_reviews.author: Lea Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Great for shaving legs!
customer_reviews.text: As a person who shaves their legs/armpits I got really tired of the expensive yet cheaply made disposable razors that you can't even recycle so I bought this on a whim. Using this on my legs was scary at first but there are some good tutorials to watch that really helped. This is the best shave I've gotten from a razor and I don't get razor burn anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to like this razor, but after using antique Gillette DE razors, I definitely got what I paid for. The look of the razor and feel of the handle is interesting, but the curvature of the top of the razor is flatter that almost any other DE razor I've seen. So a painful shave it was with a few nicks, which I never get with any of my other razors. Maybe it works for someone out there, but not this man... I kept it just for the "look" in the collection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality. Bad shave.
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is nice. Very solid. I'm just not sure about the usability. This is not my first single blade razor, and I do know how to use them. With that said, I have given this thing 3 tries, and have butchered my face, every single time. My best shave was only 3 cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: This is the item to get.
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to buy this at first because I feel like regular razors are fine but I’m on a zero waste kick and this was one of the items all the YouTube videos say to buy. Let me say this is probably my favorite product I’ve bought thus far on my zero waste journey. I shaved everywhere and it works perfect. Does it take probably a little longer to use? Sure. But the shave is a lot cleaner and it’s a lot nicer for your skin. I usually use conditioner and shaving cream combo to shave and I only used shaving cream and it left no razor bumps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice razor, very low cost
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of shaving with razor replacements that cost $5 each and came across this razor. It works well and isn't too difficult to get the hang of... I was pretty well adapted after the first 1-2 shaves. It retains heat well so feels nice and warm on your face when shaving with warm water. The replacement blades are dirt cheap ($0.10/blade, and each blade has 4 edges) and as a bonus they don't have any plastic... if you're concerned with that.
customer_reviews.author: Techie

customer_reviews.title: great shave, cheaper and better than a name brand.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this razor because it was lighter and had the butterfly opening, which is much easier to use and safer. Sooner or later if you pick up enough of these blades you will cut yourself. Anyway, it has been giving me a nice close shave without nicks or gouges and no razor burn. It is easy to hold and control, no problems with the blade twisting on you, got a great balance to it, surprised me. For this kind of performance I feel like buying another one just for backup. Brands tend to disappear after awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Curt O

customer_reviews.title: Beware of cheap product.
customer_reviews.text: Product was not whatvwas pictured and quality was cheap. Completely mislead in the sale.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Simple, old school smooth mechanism, makes it hard to drop blades for you to step on (yup been there) even with wet/soapy hands. Treat with respect when loaded with a blade. No issues at all, bought this a couple of months ago and used most days since. Looks kinda good too and the handle is plenty textured and thick enough so easy to use without (again) dropping it and slicing your feet. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: Better than other razors i've used
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this razor takes practice to get a perfectly close shave without cutting yourself but as a beginner user I'm proud to report after a few months using this that I have had no problems with razor bumps, cuts, and can actually shave with this razor. Other razors I've used have had awkward blade positions where I couldn't figure out how to shave. The blades last a long time. I keep this in my shower and haven't noticed rusting or other water-related damages. I am happy with the product and wish they had these in smaller sizes so I could shave smaller areas.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Although this product is marketed more to men, I am a woman & love using it. I wanted to start using this as a plastic free alternative to disposable razors. At first I was intimidated by the idea of trying one out for fear of cutting myself but it is easier than I thought it would be. One thing I can say is I don't get as close of a shave as I’d like, but that may be user error as I am still new to safety razors & a bit scared. I also have pretty sensitive skin & get bumps after shaving my legs usually, but I had no bad reaction to using this! It does the job :)
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: I have cut myself several times already. I think this is a cheaper alternative to the high-tech Razors which will not cut you. Not having double blades, means you will likely have to shave more often. It works well for me and for the price totally worth it. If these guys figure out a way to make the razors safer and add in a double blade option, they will own the market.
customer_reviews.author: Anowar Shahjahan

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Weishi long handle razor to replace my older chrome plated razor that had broken. The Weishi looks great, has a high quality feel to it, and is comfortable to use. I'm very pleased with my decision to purchase it! One other mention, the longer handle helps with having larger hands. I now have better control over the razor and therefore have a much better shaving experience! Thank you Weishi!
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: Not a great razor, but works
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my wife to shave her legs but she always goes back to my Merkur which is only a few bucks more. I shaved with this once and found out why... I didn't think safety razors really were all that sophisticated and figured they all work about the same but I was wrong. Don't waste your money on this item if you shave regularly... spend the extra few bucks and get something from a respected brand that's been in the business for a while. Your face will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great craftsmanship and quality shave
customer_reviews.text: A sturdy and finely crafted razor which allows for extremely close and neat shaving. I also tend to have more sensitive skin when it comes to shaving but did not have any issues what so ever with using this product. I would advise not using too much pressure while shaving, instead just let the razor lightly glide and work its magic. Applying too much pressure can cause cuts and nicks since the razor blades usually used with this tend to be very fine and sharp. This is the closest and best shave a man can get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My first safety razor This is a great looking razor with a good weight to it
customer_reviews.text: My first safety razor This is a great looking razor with a good weight to it. I started out with the blades it came with. the shave quality was ok, I figured it was from still experimenting with my technique. I ordered some good quality blades and the shave quality went way up. I was literally rubbing my face repeatedly in disbelief. If you're curious about switching to this type of shaving this is a great affordable option. Technique is huge, don't give up if you're not getting a perfect shave right from the start. I have been completely satisfied with this and wouldn't look back.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful value.
customer_reviews.text: I did a test using the heavier head Jaeger razor on one side of my face, then swapping the blade into the Weishi for the other. I found the extra weight was slightly, almost imperceptibly, better for closeness and comfort. That said, I highly recommend the razor as each face is different. The Weishi feels better in the hand and balances better, so it may be the perfect razor for you... and at a great price. You can't miss with this razor.
customer_reviews.author: excelwrite

customer_reviews.title: Great for women who shave their legs
customer_reviews.text: The long handle on this razor is excellent if you are using it to shave your legs. The blades that accompany it are not great, so buy different ones to refill your supply. Occasionally, the butterfly opening slips a little in the shower, so go slowly to avoid abrasions. If you are a woman and this is your first safety razor, use an exfoliant, a shaving cream, an after-shave, and a moisturizer to avoid razor burn and razor rash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: resonable, wish it were longer
customer_reviews.text: I got into double edge shaving recently and I bought this since it was "Amazon Choice". It came with a pack of 5 blades and a little brush that I don't know what it is for. The handle itself is well built. It's not great, it's not mediocre but it's "sufficient". I wish it were a bit longer and a bit heavier on the top. I expect as I get a bit more comfortable with double edge shaving, I'll likely want to get a better handle for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not just for guys
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this to save money & the environment. Oh my gosh it’s my favorite. I actually look forward to shaving now. It gives me the closest shave ever! The blade usually lasts three to four showers depending on how much I’m shaving. The razor is heavier than your disposable plastic one but it’s nice to hold, especially with the longer handle and using the weight of it makes it so you don’t have to press down hard. You do shave at a slightly different angle than a disposable, but like other reviews, just take your time and you’ll get the hang of it pretty quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Skin too sensitive for this blade
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this concept. Its very well made, very high quality. I can tell this company put a ton of time into their product and they did an amazing job. Unfortunately my skin is far too sensitive for one blade. No matter how light the pressure, I bleed all over. I like to line up my bear and dont do a full shave, its hard to start middle of the face and do light trimming, especially around your lips and neck. Glad I gave it a shot, unfortunately not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Bessette

customer_reviews.title: From a Lady: cost effective, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Welp, I'll probably never have to buy another razor again. It effectively shaves my legs, underarms, and... everywhere else. It's much easier to use than my research suggested - really not all that different than a disposable. And it didn't sever my leg at the slightest tremor of my hand, like I expected. That's good, I guess, but I am a little disappointed. For real, it gives a smooth shave, but I find that I need to shave slightly more frequently than before to keep up with it. Oh, and razor burn (which has ALWAYS been a problem for my thin, fair, sensitive skin) is NO issue.
customer_reviews.author: Linnea Milk

customer_reviews.title: Great Razor! Saves So Much Money!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this since October 2016 (with astra blades, per a lot of these reviews). I use it every day or two and I have stored it in the shower and in the bathroom cabinet. It isn't showing any signs of age at all. No discoloration, still opens smooth and closes tight. If you're still paying for disposable razors, I definitely recommend you give this one a try! I'll certainly never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Dal

customer_reviews.title: This is my first safety razor and I'm loving it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first safety razor and I'm loving it so far. I don't have much to compare it to though. You need to adjust the cutting angle a bit, compared to any of the multi-blade razors on the market, but it's not a steep learning curve. The butterfly design allows you to change out the blade at ease and secures it without any risk of accidents. My only minor gripe is that I notice a bit of rust/patina(?) on the razor after a little bit. It rubs off with a little effort but I think this is more of an issue with my home's 'hard water' and not a defect with the razor itself (I hope).
customer_reviews.author: theBilliot

customer_reviews.title: Close shave but irritates the skin. Will give nicks and cuts if you're not used to it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good razor for its price point and easy to use with the butterfly mechanism but it can irritate the skin a lot. Definitely not for people with sensitive skin. It does give a very close shave much closer than those horrible viking chieftain razors. I would say this is moderately aggressive. It can give you a lot of nicks and cuts. There are better razors out there but if you want something cheap this razor is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Pew newsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Should come with a warning label!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this razor in effort to reduce my carbon footprint and not use more disposable plastic. On the plus side- this razor does give a great shave that traditional razors can't achieve. However, this comes at a huge cost because the slightest extra pressure or wrong angle which happens often results in unsightly cuts and nicks. And now my once flawless leg has multiple scars from the razor puncturing the skin. So buyers beware!!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend to anyone looking to move away from disposable blades
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical of this at first as I have only used disposable razors and briefly tried a straight edge (was not a fan). This worked very well. A very close shave with no irritation. I did go through a blade using it just once, but as the blades are very low cost this is not an issue for me. I also have very thick facial hair. I was able to use this on longer hair (over 1/4") without having to use a trimmer first which is an advantage over disposables. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to move away from disposable blades.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea of it but I'm too dumb for this
customer_reviews.text: I've been shaving my legs for 20 years. I switched to single blade a few months ago and I CAN'T FOR THE LIFE OF ME shave my legs without cutting myself. It's obviously a me problem and I'm gonna Power thru it and try to learn the curve but it's worth noting. Also do not leave this in the shower - seriously. The blades rust pretty quickly and at that point you're just wasting them
customer_reviews.author: Totoraux

customer_reviews.title: It's actually not bad
customer_reviews.text: Overall a nice affordable unit, seems to be well made. I wish it came with more than one razor, I guess that's another way they cut costs down. Its easy to use, start at a 45° angle and figure out what cuts the best for you. I just shaved with it and didnt cut myself. Best advice is to go slow and take your time but it is worth it for a nice clean shave! I'm not sure if a disposable razor of any brand could compare to the shave of a safety razor. I dont think I'll use the Mach 3 again.
customer_reviews.author: Cooter

customer_reviews.title: Top quality razor.
customer_reviews.text: Top quality razor. This just saves you so much money it's ridiculous, not to mention the shave is impeccable. I do tend to get razor burn around the bikini area, but as long as the edge isnt dull then I don't have any issues. Made very well.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Whitley

customer_reviews.title: bit of a learning curve? (don't damage your face)
customer_reviews.text: hubby bought this because he was sick of spending so much on his razor refills. he used it once. ok: only HALF of his face! and since he damaged that side so much, he gave up. gave it to our son in law.... hopefully, with our warnings, he won't do the same! =)
customer_reviews.author: BuddingRose66

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Everything is very well-made. It may feels heavy for beginners and you may cut yourself a bit (like I did at my ankle but I'm clumsy) but fear not, just start slow and go slow, until you get used to it. The blade of every razor is sharp for the first few uses anyway (even the Gillette Venus). My legs and underarms are so smooth after only 1 stroke, which can't be done with regular disposable razor. And the best part is you can save a ton of plastic that could have gone to the landfill which would take thousands years to decompose. Love this masterpiece!
customer_reviews.author: LUNA

customer_reviews.title: Bad handle grip
customer_reviews.text: Butterfly mechanisms work good. Makes it easier to replace blades than traditional. My one complaint about this razor is the grip on the handle. It’s deceiving because it looks like it has good grip pattern. But I’m finding that every time I use the razor it slips down from my grip while I’m shaving. For this reason I would not buy again. My old razor was a Mercur. That one had an excellent handle grip. But I wanted to try a butterfly style that’s why I bought this one. I don’t recommend this purchase. I should have stuck with Mercur.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Gets Some Getting Used To
customer_reviews.text: These are great, but keep in mind that after shaving a couple times I noticed it doesn't give you that close shave (maybe I might be doing it wrong) but I have been looking at tips online. Value of the blades, however, are amazing, you just pop one out when you feel the blade has outlasted its use and they're DIRT cheap per blade even the higher quality ones (I recommend nothing but high-quality blades). I also recommend NOT shaving from bottom to top with it upside down, I tried it just to see and I ended up with multiple cuts.
customer_reviews.author: adia92

customer_reviews.title: My go-to razor
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this razor I had a Vander Hagen handle. When I bought this along with some Feather blades I noticed an immediate improvement over what I had been using. This razor is easy to use, has good weight, and is very durable. I like this type of shaving for both comfort and cheap blades, I'm not a huge hobbyist like many others out there. So, from my point of view this is a simple product that works effectively. Couldn't tell you how it compares to super expensive versions. But if you're like me and you have more to worry about than the razor you use in the morning you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: Very tricky aggressive
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, throw the Weishi razors out as they are just dull and pull like crazy. Next you need to know that even with a decent razor in this handle it's still very aggressive. It is very unforgiving so you'll have to go slow. I shave my head with this style of handle and I will tell you that I won't even chance using this one. If I have to I can use this one to shave my face only. If you are looking to buy your first one I definitely suggest getting a less aggressive/forgiving handle from one of the top brands. If you're an expert looking for a challenge then this one might give you something to do.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: my mom said I was crazy
customer_reviews.text: My mom said I was crazy getting a razor like she learned how to shave her legs with and would remove layers of skin and cut myself a lot. However, it the easiest razor and smoothest shave I have ever used/had. Also extremely easy to clean the dead skin out of. I even shaved my under arm area on the first try no issues. I will not be going back to multi blade razors again very happy
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: ... on a whim because i was tired of plastic waste that comes with disposable shavers
customer_reviews.text: i bought this on a whim because i was tired of plastic waste that comes with disposable shavers. im a girl and i usually use it for my pits and legs with no problems at all. It's also nice for the bikini area and I don't have problems and havent cut myself on accident with it at all. I just wish the handle was longer, I feel its slightly shorter than a nice disposable razor. I like that it comes with some blades and they're easy to switch out.
customer_reviews.author: moon unit

customer_reviews.title: The shaving cream/soap he purchased with it is awesome. No strong horrid smell which assaults the senses
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this razor, I was raving about it to my hubby and he tried mine and then bought his own. The shaving cream/soap he purchased with it is awesome. No strong horrid smell which assaults the senses. I can actually go near him when he shaves now and not avoid him until the stink of shaving foam disappears. Definitely recommend for anyone who is looking to purchase a new razor or switching from plastic disposable ones to a more sustainable razor. Oh, my daughter tried it and wants her own too. My son doesn't shave yet, but I am sure we will purchase one for him when the time comes :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I'll update this later. I got this and I was impressed by the finish and quality. I didn't try the blade due to bad experience I had with another blade that came with a past shaver. (Mid century). Usually free items that come with something aren't the best product (i.e. USB cables, etc). Anyways I can't speak for that. But this has held up decently so far. And holds the blade evenly.
customer_reviews.author: TheMrRick

customer_reviews.title: Great for this beginner
customer_reviews.text: (Female review) This is my first safety razor on my road to a zero plastic bathroom. I was worried based on people saying it’ll take a few times to learn it and to watch tutorials. Well I used it for the first time with just soap (because no money for shaving cream) and I had zero cuts and minimal bumps after shaving legs, pits, and even pubes! I do recommend watching at least one tutorial, but it’s much easier and less intimidating than it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great change from plastic
customer_reviews.text: Loveeee. I changed from plastic razors and I’m so happy with this safety razor. If you’re a female and have been thinking about changing from plastic, do it! Just take your time and you’ll get use to it and get fast in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: The Right Length Safety Razor
customer_reviews.text: As far as build quality I would say this is on par with my Viking Chieftain however I do like the longer length of this handle better. Without having the specs or a ruler in front of me I would say the Weishi is a good one inch longer. This is just because of what I am used too the length of the handle is the exact same length as the disposable razors I used to use.
customer_reviews.author: SWW

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Razor
customer_reviews.text: The safety razor is amazing for any new person considering starting to shave with these types of blades. The way it allows the blades to protrude just enough but not too much has allowed me a beginner since February to allow my face to stay, clean shaven and cut free. Overall I would say it is a worthwhile product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas VanAllen

customer_reviews.title: My first safety razor
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It is very heavy, plenty long enough for me and just easy to use. I have had mine for a few months now and it works great. No issues with it it trying to open up while shaving or anything. I honestly dont see why you would ever need anything else. These are cheap and work wonderfully. I highly recommend anyone starting out to get this razor. I absolutely love mine!
customer_reviews.author: D. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: If you are a woman trying to decide if you should make the switch, I HIGHLY recommend this razor. I have very sensitive skin and used to barely make out of the shower before my legs started burning and itching all over with a classic disposable blade. Now I have zero burning, zero nicks, and insanely smooth skin. I found it to be extremely easy to get used to. My sister did not. I would definitely give it a try though! I will never go back to disposables.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Total gimmick.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to replace plastic razors with this. It is pretty to look at! It does NOT get a close shave, even if you replace the blades frequently. I constantly missed spots and have stubble still left. It also cut me a TON, even after lots and lots of practice and patient use. Just a total waste of money, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Made a convert out of me
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about a month now and am completely satisfied. Recently converted from one of the 5-blade cartridge styles and I'm left sitting here why I didn't do it sooner. This has gotten me a closer shave than I ever got with the multi-blades. I've only nicked myself a couple of times, but I'm willing to chalk it up to learning curve. The razor has nice weight to it which is really nice. The butterfly mechanism makes cleaning post-shave super easy, and blade changes don't take any longer than swapping out a cartridge. This model comes with five blades, which should give you a decent intro.
customer_reviews.author: fauxpunker

customer_reviews.title: Good Handle but buy different blades!
customer_reviews.text: I bought of these for my husband and younger brother as a gift and I must say the handle is very heavy duty! Please note that you should toss the blades they come with because they have burms that will cut your face up. I laughed when I saw both of their faces after their first shave but it looked painful and annoying so I thought I would share that after my dad said that the blades were no good. I recommend this handle but research and buy different blades!
customer_reviews.author: RG93017

customer_reviews.title: Great razor at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great razor. I switched from an old safety razor passed down by my grandfather, which I have been shaving with for years. I wanted to try something new, something with a longer handle. I actually get a better shape with this razor, though I am using the same blades, as I feel of the blade comes off at a different angle. My only concern is the longevity of this razor, but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: John Colangelo

product_meta.title: Weishi Nostalgic Long Handle Butterfly Open Double Edge Safety Razor
feature_bullets: Hold the blades by the sides. Place the blade in the blade chamber. Give the handle a gentle shake to help seat the blade. Make sure the blade is centered from end to end and hold the razor head level. Twist the knob located at the bottom of the razor handle to close the blade chamber until completely closed and the blade is secure. Now your WEISHI is ready for an unbelievable shave.
Net Weight of Razor: 74g,Measurement: 11CM total length.
Pakage contents: 1 x WEISHI Long Handle Version Razor / 5 X WEISHI Stainless Blades / Instructions

Here are four keys to a successful shave Use as little pressure as possible. 1-Let the weight of the razor do the work for you. 2-Hold razor by the tip of the handle. 3-Angle the blade at a 45 degrees angle. 4-Shave with the grain of your beard.
This is a beautiful safety razor for either your own use or a gift. The blades are in the bottom of the black safety razor box.
